name: 10 Questions: Song of Solomon Multiple Choice Quiz | Religion
tags: Song of Songs / Song of Solomon

questions.text: What kind of song is the 'Song of Solomon'?
questions.explanation:
love song.

	Solomon's name means peace. He had great wisdom, wealth and power. He is the eleventh son of King David, and his mother was Bathsheba.

questions.text: What does verse 2:15 (KJV) say the vines have?
questions.explanation:
grapes.

	Song of Solomon 2:15 "Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes." Grapes must have been an important fruit in Biblical times. In the Last Supper they drank unfermented wine, which would have been made of grapes.

questions.text: What was Solomon's chariot made out of?
questions.explanation:
wood of Lebanon.

	Song of Solomon 3:9 "King Solomon made himself a chariot of the wood of Lebanon." It is believed that the wood of Lebanon was cedar wood.

questions.text: What does he compare her neck to in verse 4:4 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
tower of David.

	Solomon 4:4 "Thy neck is like the tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men." The Tower of David was a fortress built to protect Jerusalem.

questions.text: What does he say is under her tongue?
questions.explanation:
honey and milk.

	Song of Solomon 4:11 "Thy lips, O my spouse, drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under thy tongue; and the smell of thy garments is like the smell of Lebanon." This implies she must have been kind in words as honey is very sweet, and milk which coats can be very soothing.

questions.text: What does the woman say his lips are like?
questions.explanation:
lilies.

	Song of Solomon 5:13 "His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh." There are over 100 species in the lily family which is known as Liliaceae.  The most commonly recognized lily is the Easter lily.

questions.text: What does she say he is as beautiful as?
questions.explanation:
Tirzah.

	Song of Solomon 6:4 "Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners." Tizah was a town in what was the Samaritan high lands. The name means "she is friendly".

questions.text: What does she say is like the best wine?
options: the wine he brought for dinner
questions.explanation:
the roof of his mouth.

	Song of Solomon 7:9 "And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine for my beloved, that goeth down sweetly, causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak."

questions.text: Love is as strong as _________according to Song of Solomon 8:6 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
death.

	This is shown throughout the Bible. In fact in many cases love proves stronger than death. For example, in the New Testament, when Jesus gives His life for our sins. Our bodies die, but his love for us overcomes death so we die in this life, but will be alive again in a new life if we accept his love and what he did for us as a result of that love.

questions.text: What is the last word of Song of Solomon (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
spices.

	Song of Solomon 8:14 "Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices." I hope you enjoyed this quiz. The next Bible quiz in my Biblical series will be on the book of Isaiah.
